description:
With current state of the codebase, vMotion will be a no-op if a VM has a RDM to a iSCSI cinder volume because the target host where the VM should be moved doesn't know the iSCSI target of the host where the VM is initially running.
This means that the VM cannot move and have to stay on the same host as soon as there is a RDM.
title: VMware: iSCSI targets needs to be propagated to all hosts of the cluster
